pullRequest.body:
We define the restriction of a matroid to a set, the resulting partial order on the set of matroids on a type, and give associated API. 

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

Thanks, looks good! Except for scoping the notation, my suggestions are just cosmetic changes.

Once you address these, I think it's ready to merge.

bors d+

Thanks, looks good! Except for scoping the notation, my suggestions are just cosmetic changes.

Once you address these, I think it's ready to merge.

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← base_restrict_iff] at hI'; rw [← base_restrict_iff] at hJ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← base_restrict_iff] at hI hJ; exact hI.eq_exchange_of_diff_eq_singleton hJ hIJ ```

When you introduce a type synonym, you're also responsible for introducing a constructor and projection function, and promising to use them everywhere.

I suspect you would do better to use a one-field structure here, since there are very few instances on `Matroid` to copy across:
```suggestion
/-- A type synonym for matroids with the restriction order.
  (The `PartialOrder` on `Matroid α` is reserved for the minor order)  -/
structure Matroidᵣ (α : Type*) where ofMatroid ::
  toMatroid : Matroid α
```

As discussed above, this lemma is poorly typed; it should be 
```suggestion
@[simp] protected theorem Matroidᵣ.le_iff {M M' : Matroidᵣ α} : M ≤ M' ↔ M.toMatroid ≤r M'.toMatroid := Iff.rfl
@[simp] protected theorem Matroidᵣ.lt_iff {M M' : Matroidᵣ α} : M < M' ↔ M.toMatroid <r M'.toMatroid := Iff.rfl
```

```suggestion
* `M.restrict R`, written `M ↾ R`, is the restriction of `M : Matroid α` to `R : Set α`: i.e.
```

Let's make it scoped so that you have to opt-in with `open Matroid` or be in the `Matroid` namespace already.
```suggestion
scoped infixl:65 " ↾ " => Matroid.restrict
```

```suggestion
scoped infix:50 " ≤r " => Restriction
```

```suggestion
scoped infix:50 " <r " => StrictRestriction
```

```suggestion
    rintro ⟨R, hR, h₁⟩ ⟨R', hR', h₂⟩
```
